!image-2021-12-10-15-02-01-076.png!

!image-2021-12-10-15-01-46-508.png|width=152,height=226!

The Confluence preview is exact the same as the Excel Preview.

The Confluence preview is different from the Excel Preview

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the [Search content by CQL|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content/#api-wiki-rest-api-content-search-get] REST API, an incorrect page title is returned when it contains a '?' at the start of the page title. The page title is incorrect when:
 # There's a question mark at the beginning of the page title, and
 # The Contains Operator '~' is used to search the page title.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with a question mark '?' at the beginning of the title, for example, "?Page Title".
 # Run the below API call with an equal operator.
 ** {color:#0747a6}+[https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/search?cql=title=|https://xxxx.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/search?cql=title=]"?Page Title"+{color}

 # Run the below API call with Contains operator.
 ** +{color:#0747a6}[https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/search?cql=title~|https://aminute.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/search?cql=title~]"?Page Title"{color}+

h3. Expected Results

Both calls return the same page title.
h3. Actual Results

The first call correctly returns the page title of "?Page Title", whereas the second call incorrectly returns the page title as "Page Title" for the same page (check PageID) without the question mark.
h3. Workaround

Include the *Expand* parameter in the API call.
 * Example: {color:#0747a6}+[https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/search?cql=title~|https://aminute.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/search?cql=title~]"?Test Page"&expand=space+{color}
fields.summary: Search Content REST API returns an incorrect page title when it contains a '?' at the start of the page title

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Formatting issues with Page->PDF Export: When Images are placed side by side on a Confluence page and the left image has the _wrap left_ attribute and the right image has the  _wrap right_ attribute. On Exporting the page to a PDF the right image will fall to a newline or disappear

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Confluence page
 # Add two images next to each other on the page
# Assign left-wrap, and right-wrap to the corresponding images
# export to PDF

h3. Expected Results
* Images are exported to PDF on the same line

h3. Actual Results
* Right image goes to the next line, or may disappear if enough images are present on the page



h3. Workaround
# Add the Confluence layout macro to the page
# Add images inside each cell
# center-align the image to ensure its full-size
# Page Export->PDF
fields.summary: Exporting a Confluence Page to PDF with two images side-by-side will cause the right image to fall to a new line or disappear

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Hi team! I am working with Servicerocket in a ticket related to Confluence connect macros. They develop [Scaffolding Forms & Templates|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/190/scaffolding-forms-templates?tab=overview&hosting=cloud] and currently they have found an issue with their app.When filling one of their Field Group macros with a {{|}} (pipe character) anywhere in the body, {{getContentMacro}} fails to retrieve the data. They have added more details in the ticket but I could also replicate it with the same exceptions in my testing environment. My understanding is that not many customers would use a pipe character, however, when they do their Live Templates are rendered completely useless.

Please see these tickets and page for a full writeup (from the Connect team). The Connect team has passed this over to the Confluence team as it pertains to Confluence specific connector code:

[https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~890104860/pages/1444578329/OC-1809+AP.confluence.getMacroData+fails+on+pipe+character]

[https://atlassian.slack.com/archives/CFGTZ99TL/p1637788223014600]

[https://atlassian.slack.com/archives/CFHD7ERB4/p1639000206445000]
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Full reproduction steps can be found in the DEVHELP ticket: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-7375
h3. Expected Results

User can include a pipe character in their macro.
h3. Actual Results

Trying to parse the JSON returned by `AP.confluence.getMacroData` fails with an `Unexpected end of JSON input` error, as the data returned is chopped off at where the pipe character was.
h3. Workaround

Don't use the pipe character.
fields.summary: Using pipe | in macro causes AP.confluence.getMacroData to corrupt macro data

fields.description:

fields.description:
When the 'content' parameter of the 'Blog Posts' macro is set to 'excerpts', links within the blog post are displayed as plain text, instead of hypertext. While when the 'content' parameter is set to 'entire' hypertext links are shown.
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a blog post with a link on its body
 # Add the Blog Posts macro to a page
 # Set the macro 'content to display' parameter to 'excerpts'
 # Save the page

h4. Workaround

Use the 'content' parameter as 'entire', if possible. or use Excerpt macro in the blog post (works only with internal page link)
fields.summary: Excerpts on Blog Posts macro display links as plain text

The Advanced Roadmaps for Jira plan macro is read-only and users are unable to make any changes that would reflect directly in the Plan.

To make any changes, you will have to open the view in Advanced Roadmaps and make the changes from there.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a macro is copied and pasted above another macro, the cursor selects the following macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a macro (Macro 1) and copy it. e.g. File&Image, Table, Jira, etc.
 # Move the cursor to the above of the macro with arrow keys.
 # Paste the macro. (Macro 2)

h3. Expected Results

The cursor ends up on the same line as Macro 2 or a new line is created between Macro 1 and Macro 2

h3. Actual Results

After pasting Macro 1 is selected.

h3. Workaround

After moving above the macro before pasting, hit the enter to create a new line.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Performing space import from cloud sometimes causes add-on system users to be imported with product license, causing unexpected billing.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Cannot reproduce from reporter's environment, however the steps are reported as below:
 # Install some add-ons on source Confluence site
 # Perform space import on destination Confluence site following the steps on [https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/import-a-confluence-cloud-space/]

h3. Expected Results

Add-on system users will be imported alongside the space, without product license.
h3. Actual Results

Add-on system users will be imported alongside the space *with* product license
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no workaround, however admins can compare the license counts from:
[User CSV Export with 'product access' info toggled|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/export-users-from-a-site/] and [Billing > Manage subscriptions|https://support.atlassian.com/subscriptions-and-billing/docs/manage-your-bill-for-standard-and-premium-plans/]. If there is a difference in license count, then contact Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: Performing space import from cloud causes add-on system users to be imported with product license

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Non-English language in profile results in Jira issue link statuses being shown in grey color.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Insert a Jira issue link in any Confluence page. The Jira issue should be in Done status so that it is green in color. (Screenshot1, Screenshot2).

 # Navigate to https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences and change the profile language to non-English (say Korean). Refresh the page again. The Jira issue status will be shown in grey color (Screenshot3, Screenshot4)

h3. Expected Results

Irrespective of the profile language the Confluence Jira issue link should display the correct color.

h3. Actual Results

If the profile language is non-English the Jira issue link status will show up in grey color.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Non-English language in profile results in Jira issue link statuses being shown in grey colour.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Confluence Cloud advanced search can be very useful to find content across our sites. In its filters, it is possible to sort our search by pages, attachments, spaces, creators, etc.
Though, the search only works for verbally expressed words in the pages, which may be a roadblock for more basic users.

h3. Suggestion
* Allow the Confluence Cloud advanced search to be able to search for HTML elements in the pages to retrieve results as well, such as a macro that may be a button named "_Click Me_", so the users would be able to search by "_Click Me_" and Confluence would be able to retrieve the pages that contain that button.
fields.summary: Allow Confluence to search for macros within pages

fields.description:
Hello,

 

I'd like to suggest the implementation of AND queries for the CQL filters of Plugins in the Page Property Report macro. This already works fine in Confluence Server and it also works for Label filters in Confluence Cloud (see attachments).

 

Server:

!image-2021-12-08-16-32-46-658.png!

 

Cloud: 

!image-2021-12-08-16-33-01-808.png!

 

This is a highly sought after Feature that is blocking Server Customers from migrating to cloud. 

This functionality is already possible in the Advanced Search since we can freely insert CQL Syntax. It would be optimal if we could use CQL syntax inside the filter inputs.

 

Kind Regards

 

Aldin Delic
fields.summary: AND Queries for Filters defined by 3rd Party Apps

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, while using drag-and-drop to move macro and images on the editor, there's no way to know the exact location the objects will be dropped.

h3. Suggested Solution
Display a text cursor at the exact location where the object will be dropped.

h3. Workaround
Use cut and paste instead, as the object will be pasted exactly where the cursor is located.
fields.summary: Display a text cursor while moving images and macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a line starts with an emoji, there's no way to type at the left of the emoji.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new line of text starting with an emoji
# Try to insert text at the beginning of the line, to the emoji's left 

h3. Expected Results
We should be able to put the cursor before the emoji, at the beginning of the line

h3. Actual Results
Moving the cursor to the left with the arrow keys will move it to the line above

h3. Workaround
Remove the emoji, insert the text and insert the emoji again.
fields.summary: Not possible to type at the beginning of the line with an emoji

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

According to [Insert Confluence Wiki Markup|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-confluence-wiki-markup], under {*}Images{*}, there's an attribute 'title' to display alternate text for an image:
{quote}Set alternate text for the image, which is displayed as a tooltip when on hover.
{quote}
However, when using the correct syntax, there is no image title on hover.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Space Settings > Look and feel > Page Layout
{noformat}
https://*.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/custompagecontent.action?key=KEY{noformat}

 # Insert syntax like
{noformat}
!image.gif|title=text!{noformat}
Save.

 # The pages in the space should have a tooltip on hover.

(!) Confirmed on Legacy and New editors.
h3. Expected Results

Image title should show as a tooltip on hover.
h3. Actual Results

No image title on hover
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Wiki markup hover Title not applied in Look and Feel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copy Page Tree add-on is not able to copy a page tree when said page tree is also added through Scroll Documents for Confluence add-on and then renamed from the Confluence Editor.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and one or more child pages under the page you just created.
 # install app Scroll Documents for Confluence (you can sign up for a free trial that's 30 days)
 # Create a new document within Scroll Documents for Confluence and use the main page you created in step 1.
 # install app Copy Page Tree (you can sign up for free trial).
 # Rename the pages created on step 1 by prefixing 'Template -'
 # Try to use copy page tree to copy the page tree of the pages renamed in step 6 to omit 'Template -' (Can copy under the same space or even within the document tree created in step 1)
 # You will see error in the process

h3. Expected Results

Copy page tree should be possible.
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.BadRequestException: The copied pages have conflicting page titles. {noformat}
h3. Workaround

Workaround 1:

you can re-add the page tree to Scroll Documents for Confluence and retry the Copy page tree

Workaround 2:

You can remove the page tree from Scroll Documents
fields.summary: Copy Page Tree Add-on fails for a page tree thats also part of Scroll Documents for Confluence

fields.description:
When clicking on the task link, e.g. in the personal task list or in the macro task list, the link should take the user to the page where the task is displayed (this works) and the window should scroll to the location of the task so that it is directly in the user's focus. 

The link {*}looks like it is intended to do that{*}. "........?focusedTaskId=42" 
But it doesn't work. 

This would provide a *significant productivity* gain for users and further improve working with Confluence tasks. 
As far as I can remember this probably worked in the server version at some point. 
Please implement this (again) into cloud. 
It would be a highlight for me and a real productivity gain!  

By the way, Chrome or Edge has a feature to copy a link to highlighted text. 
The link takes the user not only to the top of the page but scrolls to the highlighted text so you don't have to search for the right place on the page.
fields.summary: Confluence task links should work properly

fields.description:
Hello Atlassian Product Management Team

My name is Josephine. Last year I was called Joseph. For hopefully quite obvious reasons, I do not want to see my name or my old profile picture representing me to all my coworkers. I've tried _every_ day for the past four months to change my profile picture, but _every_ morning at 1 in the morning it reverts back to an old picture of me as a man. My IT has even cleared all my old logins and images and still, it reverted back.
I understand that this stems from an update  that this option is gone, there is no chance for my IT team to correct this error.
In the mean time, I still *DO* see my old username (my name), and my old image is broadcasted to all my co-workers. Far from "protecting my privacy", +*this change directly violates my privacy*+ by outing me as transgender to all my coworkers every single day. Luckily for me, I work in an environment where I don't have to worry about my coworkers killing me for this fact. However, it is still absolutely unacceptable. Many of us call our birth names "Dead Names" for good psychological reason.

This is causing me undue stress at work and I would like it corrected please.
fields.summary: Allow at least IT Teams to change usernames in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The star this page button should have the `aria-pressed` attribute

[https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Attributes/aria-pressed]

missing here: /wiki/home/recent

Looks like that component is used elsewhere too

Other bugs:
 * aria-label should go on the button, not the nested span
 * buttons are already interactive and should not need the tabindex=0 value
 * buttons do not need type=button, that is the default already
 * Why is role='presentation' wrapping the button (parent element)?
 * There is an unnecessary div between role=presentation and button .. trying using React.Fragment instead

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View star button in recents component
 # Step 2

h3. Expected Results

Button has aria-pressed attribute
h3. Actual Results

missing attribute, our customers using screen readers won't know it is a toggle

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Star button missing aria-pressed attribute

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding the Jira issue macro with a Date Field to a page, Confluence takes into account the default timezone setting in Jira to display the time. 

This happens when the default time zone from Jira is different from the one in Confluence. The Confluence time zone is the same as the maintenance window from the site.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Jira, go to General configuration.
 # On {*}Default user time zone{*}, choose a timezone different from the one on your maintenance window. 
 # Create a Jira issue with a Date field. Set a time for this field.
 # Go to Confluence and add a Jira macro.
 # Add the issue you created and choose to display the Date field.

In Jira, the time will be a time difference between the Default Setting in Jira and the time zone from your maintenance window. 

(!) It doesn't take into account the time zone under personal settings.

h3. Expected Results

The time should be the same in Jira and Confluence.
h3. Actual Results

Time is different in Jira and Confluence
h3. Workaround

Having the default Jira timezone to be the same as the maintenance window from the site. This might not be possible for most of the users.
fields.summary: Date field in Jira macro displays wrong time if default Jira timezone is different from GMT-3

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The issue seems to happen consistently when links are copied from inside an HTML table. When you highlight multiple cells then copy and paste it into the editor, the links show blue but are gone after publishing it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new empty page
 # Highlight and copy a link that is inside an HTML table. (I made a fiddle to save us time looking for sample material: [https://jsfiddle.net/gtu06d59/]).
 # Paste it on the editor
 # Hit Publish

h3. Expected Results

Links should be preserved
h3. Actual Results
Links are lost and even while in edit mode, the links are not customizable.

h3. Workaround

Manually copy the links and use the link macro instead. (Not optimal when trying to copy bulk links)
fields.summary: Links pasted on the page are lost after publishing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per the documentation: [https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-or-remove-page-restrictions#AddorRemovePageRestrictions-Requestandgrantpermissions]
{quote}If the page creator is unable to grant permission (if their account is deactivated or if their page access has been revoked), then we’ll send the email to the last person who updated the page. If no page creators or editors are able to grant permission, then we’ll send the email to a space admin.
{quote}
However, no email was sent to the space admin at all and a prompt is shown instead saying "Access request unsuccessful".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # *Author* creates a restricted page
 # *Author* account gets suspended
 # Go to the restricted page as another user
 # Click on *Request Access*

h3. Expected Results

As per documentation, an email should be sent to the space admin.
h3. Actual Results

A prompt is shown saying "Access request unsuccessful".
!image-2021-12-02-17-32-58-645.png|width=343,height=204!

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Request access" on a requested page does not behave as per documentation

fields.description: Right now, when creating a Custom emoji, users have to first type a name to have the button 'Choose file' enabled. It would be quite more intuitive to make the upload button available and give an error message if the user forgets to add a name.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When expanding content body, we noticed that {{body.export_view}} is significantly slower than {{body.view}} even though the output is very similar. Due to this {{body.export_view}} expands are causing timeouts.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use [Get content descendants by type|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content---children-and-descendants/#api-wiki-rest-api-content-id-descendant-type-get] API 
 # Select page id which has a good amount of child pages. 
 # Add expansions - body.export_view.webresource.tags.all, body.export_view.webresource.superbatch.tags.all,metadata.labels,ancestors

Example:

<HOST>/wiki/rest/api/content/<PAGE_ID>/descendant/page?limit=200&expand=body.export_view.webresource.tags.all%2Cbody.export_view.webresource.superbatch.tags.all%2Cancestors&start=0
h3. Expected Results

Expected 200 response
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
the document fails to load {noformat}
h3. Workaround

Try to use body.view expansions and try to call API with a smaller limit (Query param `limit`), Try with limit=50.
fields.summary: Increased latency for EXPORT_VIEW content bodies

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A customer wants to be able to configure permissions per add-on so that they can configure content access for anonymous users for each add-on instead of using global space permissions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select a space inside the Confluence.
 # Space Setting
 # Space Permissions
 # Add-on Tab
 # In this step you should be able to manage the anonymous user permissions for the chosen add-on.

h3. Expected Results

Be able to configure custom content permissions for anonymous users in the app permissions
h3. Actual Results

you can only manage anonymous user permissions through global space permissions.
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: add an option to manage anonymous user permissions by add-on within space permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

The customer is trying to apply for default permission from Space *Settings>Permission>Override all permissions* but ends up in the below error.
{quote}Couldn't change space permissions
If this keeps happening, let us know at
support.atlassian.com
{quote}
Usually, that's because when a space was created anonymously (by anonymous users) in Server, there was no creator set while creating them in Confluence Server and upon migration, the database didn't catch that information.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the space in Confluence Cloud that you want to change permissions for 
 # Select *Space Settings* from the sidebar.
 # Select *General* from the *Space permissions* card.
 ## The *Space permissions* card is only visible if you're a space admin in that space.
 # Open the *Override all permissions* drop-down menu and select {*}Default Permissions{*}.

h3. Expected Results
 * The default permission should override the space permissions.

h3. Actual Results
 * Ends up in the error:
{quote}Couldn't change space permissions
If this keeps happening, let us know at
support.atlassian.com
{quote}
 * And if checking in the console when overriding it shows something like:
 
*HTT Header POST 200*

{code:java}
<instance>.alassian.com/cgraphql?q=DefaultPermissions
{code}

*And the response*
{code:java}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: You are not allowed to add the SETPAGEPERMISSIONS permission to the anonymous user."
{code}
h3. Workaround

The creator of the space can be updated in Cloud by an Atlassian Support Engineer. 

OR

Before exporting the space in Server, customers can check *spaces* that are without *creator* by running:
{code:java}
select * from spaces where creator is null;
{code}
and when with {*}user_key{*}, the creator can be updated by:
{code:java}
update spaces set creator = '<USER_KEY>' where lowerspacekey = '<LOWER_SPACEKEY>';
{code}
fields.summary: Override all permissions on spaces ends up in error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we have an Expand macro that contains a Variable macro within the expand box, the variable cannot be filled while creating a new page. When clicked on expand, it directly creates a page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new template or edit an existing one.
 # Add an Expand macro.
 # Inside the expand box, add the variable macro.
Add Expand macro with some random text.
 # Save the template.
 # Try to create a new page using the template.
 # When you select the template and click on expand, it auto-creates the page without letting us fill in the variable field.

This happens for both Global Templates and Space Templates.
h3. Expected Results

When clicked on expand, it should expand and allow us to fill the variable field.
h3. Actual Results

When clicked on expand, it auto-creates a page with empty data in the variable field.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Variables inside Expand macro cannot be filled while creating a page using Templates

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *excerpt-include* macro allows you to refer to a page that’s been archived, even though the preview pane shows the error in the screenshot below. An excerpt referenced in this manner shows up correctly in the edit and view mode of the page.

However if you try to do the same thing by using the macro within another macro like {*}Table of Content Zone{*}, the macro breaks with the same error ({_}Error message: "Error rendering macro 'excerpt-include' : No link could be created for '<SpaceKey>:<Page>'."{_}) in the view mode, although it does display the correct content in edit mode.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a page on your instance, use the *excerpt* macro to create an excerpt, and then archive the page.
 # On another page, use the *excerpt-include* macro to refer to the page created in step 1. The preview pane of the macro will show an error.
 # Save the macro settings and you'll see that the edit mode, as well as the view mode after publishing, show the excerpt.
 # Now repeat step 2, but put the *excerpt-include* macro inside another macro like {*}Table of Content Zone{*}.
 # You will see that the page renders the excerpt in the edit mode, but breaks with the same as error as in _Preview pane_ in view mode.

h3. Expected Results

The *excerpt-include* macro should behave consistently in all scenarios when working with archived pages.
h3. Actual Results

The *excerpt-include* macro works correctly when working with archived pages when it's at the root of the page but breaks when it's nested within another macro
h3. Workaround

The only workaround is to move the macro out of the nesting, which may not always be the intended use case.
fields.summary: Excerpt Include macro breaks for archived pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Team Calendars has a bunch of factors that takes into consideration for the date and time format but this issue makes it look like the time format setting on Team Calendars doesn't work. On this issue however, after creating the event on the calendar and changing the settings, if you go to *My Calendars* instead of the *Space Calendar* view, the format is correct but the behavior is inconsistent.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an empty space
 # Create a new calendar on the space
 # Add an event and choose a specific time for the event instead of whole day (e.g. 15:00 - 18:00)
 # Change the time format on the Team Calendars page to a different format

h3. Expected Results
The calendar should adjust the format accordingly including the existing events

h3. Actual Results
The old time format is persisting on the already created events on the Calendar

h3. Workaround
 Changing the Language preference in Atlassian account settings refreshes the Calendar and fixes this issue. Steps for changing language preferences can be found here: [https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-your-language-preferences/]
fields.summary: Changes on the time format on Team Calendars are not reflecting

# Place on Team Calendar in Confluence

h3. Expected Results
The Event card should start exactly at 5:01 PM on Nov 24th and then end on 5:01 PM on Nov 25th.

It appears as an full day event for the first selected date

Currently No Known workaround

h3. Issue Summary

If you edit a Confluence page and re-size an image, this could cause that the next edit on the page will slightly change the image size once again, without user interaction. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a simple Confluence page, adding a phrase and an image on it. 
 # Edit this page, and re-size the attached image. 
 # Now, access the page on the edit mode, and publish a new version, {*}without performing any actual change to the page{*}. 
 # Access the Page History, and compare the *current version* with the {*}previous one{*}.

h3. Expected Results

No change should be highlighted on the comparison, since no change was applied to the page.
h3. Actual Results

The comparison will show that the image was re-added/re-sized. If you check the Storage Format of both versions, you'll also see that the image size have changed.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Uploading images on mobile causes attachment(s) to have a file name in the format "mediafile-placeholder-RANDOM_NUMBERS)". This causes all images on the page to fail to load with the "Failed to load" error message.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload several images very fast on mobile, possibly with poor wifi.

h3. Expected Results

You see all images on the page.
h3. Actual Results

All images on the page fail to load.

The request to fetch the media fails with a 401 error.
 * 
{code:java}
Request URL: https://api.media.atlassian.com/items
Request Method: POST
Status Code: 401 {code}

 * 
{code:java}
{"error":{"code":"AuthenticationError","title":"Could not decode and validate token: urn \"urn:filestore:file:mediafile-placeholder-4409179056)\" does not conform to a format \"^(\\w+):(\\w+):(\\w+):?([\\w\\-*%]+)?$\""}}{code}

h3. Workaround

Go to the attachments page and delete any files in the format "mediafile-placeholder-RANDOM_NUMBERS)". This will cause all the images on the page to load except the ones that corresponded to the files you deleted. Then you can re-upload/replace those images.
fields.summary: Uploading images on mobile causes invalid file id - mediafile-placeholder

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence Cloud Supports page versioning - changes applied on a page creates a new version of it, so you can still access and compare the previous one. However, when you access the previous version of a page, it displays the information differently - as if the page was created on the Legacy editor. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the current editor.
 # Add a table and/or an info panel to it.
 # Publish it.
 # Edit this page, making small changes to it.
 # Click on the Page *Actions menu* (three ellipses) > {*}Page History{*}. 
 # Click on the previous version hyperlink (probably {*}v. 1{*})

h3. Expected Results

The page content should load on the current editor, as the page was created using it:

!image-2021-11-22-14-07-06-801.png|width=574,height=253!
h3. Actual Results

Page content is displayed on the Legacy editor:

!image-2021-11-22-14-07-42-949.png|width=1127,height=253!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Previous versions of pages are displayed on the Legacy editor

fields.description:

 # Go to the Page History and there will be a new version with bank content

Please refer to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-73171

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
AP.Dialog.create fails without options object
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # `Hi, we discovered a bug in the Confluence Connect JavaScript API for creating a Dialog.The API is described here: <https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/jsapi/dialog/>When using the function to create a Dialog, like this:AP.dialog.create({key: 'my-module-key'})One possible option is for the key to reference a dialog as described in the app descriptor, which has the schema described here: <https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/connect-schemas/raw/master/confluence-global-schema.json>According to the schema, the following dialog description should be valid, as it contains all required fields ('url' and 'key'):dialogs: [{url: "my-url", key: "my-module-key"}]However, with this description in place, using the dialog.create function results in an error in the UI: "Unable to retrieve addon module URL. Please check your specified module key." as well as an error in the console: "POST <https://marein-alt.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/ac/my-app-key/my-module-key> 404"This error suggests that there is an error with the module key. In reality, the problem is solved by adding the 'options' field to the descriptor, even if it has just a trivial value:"dialogs": [{url: "my-url", key: "my-module-key", options: {}}]After adding this field, the dialog.create function works as expected.So, apparently there is some logic in the dialog.create function or the module key resolver which depends on the presence of the 'options' field.```
h3. Expected Results
should work as expected 
h3. Actual Results

https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/OC-1780

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: AP.Dialog.create fails without options object

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary


Webwork/XWork has seen quite a few RCEs in recent past, we have improved velocity/XStream in terms of security. Its time to tighten the ratchet also on Webwork.

As a dev, I would like to see Webwork security at par of Strut's current standards. This means it will involve looking at Strut's closed security issues and assess them against webwork.

Confluence Cloud can pick up a new version of XWork(1.0.3-atlassian-8) and Webwork(2.1.5-atlassian-4) to bring this blocklist feature in.

Please follow this page to see the steps to bring this security feature in: https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~ggautam/blog/2021/10/21/1373912668/Being+proactive+in+guarding+Confluence+DC+Cloud+OGNL+edition#Action-for-Confluence-Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

N/A
h3. Expected Results

Webwork is secure from future RCEs
h3. Actual Results

RCE is there. See [https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFSERVER/repos/confluence/pull-requests/13684/overview]
h3. Workaround

Don't use AST velocity references to userDirectives like #tag or #bodytag
fields.summary: Upgrade XWork to a version with blocklist

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* On Chrome 96 (97 beta), there's a significant performance issue when typing.
** Specifically, the issue is related to Chrome/Google's Spellchecker, and is triggered when there's a high number of typographical error,

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* On Chrome 96 (97 beta), edit a page which contains a large number of typos.
** Typing will be slow or the page will be unresponsive.

h3. Expected Results
* No performance issue, slowness, or unresponsiveness when editing a page with large number of typographical error,

h3. Actual Results

h3. Workaround
* Disable spell check on:
** chrome://settings/languages
* Downgrade Chrome.
* Use another browser.
fields.summary: Performance issues with Chrome 96 and Chrome 97 in Confluence editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In a Template that uses an Insert Page macro, changing the title of the inserted Page will cause the macro to display the following error, even in published Pages.
{code:java}
"Unable to render {include} The included page could not be found"
{code}
This is different than CONFCLOUD-68618 since every new Page created from the Template will break and also display this error if this happens.

Page excerpts break similarly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Template.
 # Use Insert Page macro and point to a Page. (note that due to CONFCLOUD-68618, the Template display the error "Unable to render include. The included page could not be found")
 # Save the Template.
 # Create a Page using this Template.
 # Publish the Page. Observe that the included page does render properly.
 # Change the included Page's title to anything else.
 # Create another new Page using this Template
 # Observe that this new Page's Insert Page macro is now displaying the error "Unable to render include. The included page could not be found".

h3. Expected Results

The Insert Page macro functions for newly created Page's using a Template with an Insert Page macro despite the inserted Page's name changing.
h3. Actual Results

The Insert Page macro instead displays the following error on all newly drafted Pages created from this Template:
{code:java}
"Unable to render {include} The included page could not be found"
{code}
h3. Workaround

Update the Template's Insert Page macro to point to the correct Page. Newly created Pages from this Template will once again have functioning Insert Page macros.
fields.summary: Changing title of a Page that is used by a Insert Page macro on a Template causes the Insert Page macro to stop working on new Pages created from this Template: "Unable to render {include}"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Filter Results* macro becomes irresponsive if we select certain fields for example *Start date* , *% Completion* .
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a *Filter results* macro on a page.
 # Click edit to add fields in the macro.
 # Select field *Start date* from the dropdown list.
 # Click again the dropdown list to look for other fields to be added.

h3. Expected Results

The Filter results macro should display other fields to be added.
h3. Actual Results

The Filter results macro becomes irresponsive, and no other field can be selected to add .

!image-2020-10-02-17-38-12-306.png|width=186,height=114!
h3. !Screen Recording 2021-02-25 at 04.34.31 PM.gif|width=239,height=115!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no workaround available.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users can add the ac:custom-content:search-body content property to custom content in confluence to add searchable text to the custom content. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom content such as a draw.io or gliffy diagram
 # Save the diagram and publish the page
 # Search for the diagram by filtering by its type and copy its ID
 # Access
{code:none}
https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/CONTENT_ID/property/ac:custom-content:search-body{code}

 # Perform a new search using the terms returned by that property

h3. Expected Results

The search should return the custom content (in this case the diagram)
h3. Actual Results

Not found

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: ac:custom-content:search-body content property is not indexed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [Page Macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-index-macro/] is known to *ONLY* work on spaces with fewer than 500 pages after which the following error is shown:

!Screenshot 2021-11-19 at 06.55.51.png|width=561,height=56!
Here is the documentation regarding exactly how the Page Index Macro Functions.
 - [Insert the page index macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-index-macro/]

However, the error message is being shown in different languages -
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert the Page Index macro in a space with more than 500 pages
 # Refresh the page multiple times

h3. Expected Results

The error message should be in English or perhaps the default language of the site.
h3. Actual Results

Refreshing the page causes the error to be shown in different languages

Examples:
{code:java}
Zu viele Seiten Das Seitenindex-Makro kann höchstens 500 Seiten anzeigen.
{code}
{code:java}
Zbyt wiele stron Makro indeksu stron może wyświetlać maksymalnie 500 stron(y).
{code}
!Screenshot 2021-11-19 at 07.05.23.png|width=633,height=66!
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Remove the Page Index macro from the page (as it does not support spaces with over 500 pages)
fields.summary: Page Index Macro error message language when having over 500 pages in a space is inconsistent

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Group names with Turkish characters like  “{*}Ç, Ğ, I, İ, Ö, Ş, and Ü”{*} are not able to access space though the group name is added to the space permission
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a group name containing the following characters  “{*}Ç, Ğ, I, İ, Ö, Ş, and Ü”{*}
 # Add user to the group
 # Now, add the group to the space permission
 # ideally, the user from the group should be able to access the space

h3. Expected Results

Space should be accessible by all the users in the group 
h3. Actual Results

Space is not accessible to users who belong to the group which contains any Turkish characters.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Do not name groups with any Turkish characters.
fields.summary: Group names with Turkish characters are not getting space permissions
Adding an invalid author on the CQL using API returns results created by Anonymous

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the [Page Properties Report macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-report-macro/] to retrieve data from the [Page Properties|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-macro/], if the page with the Page Properties macro has action items, these will not be able to be checked/unchecked on the page using the Page Properties Report macro if it is using the Legacy editor.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page to add the [Page Properties|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-macro/] macro to it. It can be a Legacy or a current/new editor page.
 # On this page, make sure to add a table to the Page Properties field and add some action items to its row(s). Add a label to this page so it can be retrieved later.
 # Create a new page using the legacy editor.
 # There, add the [Page Properties Report|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-report-macro/] macro and include the label added to the previous page on its configuration.
 # Check/uncheck the added action items

h3. Expected Results

The action items should be checked/unchecked.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens on the action items.
h3. Workaround

Check/uncheck the items in the original page containing the Page Properties macro so it will be reflected on the page with the Page Properties Report one.

(i) The page can be also [converted to the new/current editor|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/convert-pages-to-the-new-editor/], but the workaround from https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-72238 will need to be added.
fields.summary: Checking action items within a Page properties report macro on the legacy editor will not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the [Confluence Cloud REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/intro/] to retrieve results tied to different parts of Confluence, if invalid values are added to it, it will still have the results displayed instead of an error code.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Make sure [to create an API token|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-api-tokens-for-your-atlassian-account/] in order to retrieve the data via REST API.
# Use some API to retrieve content (I.E. [content|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content/#api-wiki-rest-api-content-get] or [spaces|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-space/#api-wiki-rest-api-space-get]).
# Add an invalid parameter at the end of them.

To replicate this one, the following tests were done:

{code}
 curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://my_instance.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/space/?INVALID' \
  -u 'my_email:my_token' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
{code}

(i) All spaces are returned.

{code}
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://my_instance.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/717275725849?INVALID_PARAM' \
  -u 'my_email:API_token' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \ 
{code}

(i) The content for the page is retrieved.

h3. Expected Results

An error message should be displayed or no results should come.

h3. Actual Results

The results are still displayed as if there were no invalid parameters.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding invalid parameters to the Confluence Cloud API will still return results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attachment preview link mismatch 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # This mismatch will break the *View* button on attachment page.
 
Note : clicking in *EDIT* or *attachment name/title* should load the image fine

h3. Expected Results
Ideally attachment links should preview with this URL

{code:java}
https://SITENAME.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=XXXXXXXXXXXXpreview=/XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX/image2021-10-19_10-41-16.png
{code}


h3. Actual Results
however in some cases we are seeing 
{code}
https://SITENAME.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=has XXXXXXXXX&sortBy=date&highlight=image2021-10-13_10-55-43+%281%29.png&
{code}

which leads to error 
 !image-2021-11-18-15-20-07-817.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

- To view the attachment, please click on the Attachment title in attachment page.
- You can also click on *edit* button on attachment page , that should also load the image.
fields.summary: Attachment preview link mismatch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Confluence REST API call is timing out for Content API with a higher start index, for example:
{code}http://<site>.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content?next=true&limit=200&start=156400{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test site with a large number of pages so that pagination comes into the picture.
# Execute a GET call for content API with a higher start index, for example:
{code}http://<site>.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content?next=true&limit=200&start=156400{code}

h3. Expected Results
The content should be fetched as per the start index provided.

h3. Actual Results
The API call is timing out.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. However, we can help the customer with the required content from the DB.

Search API could be used to fetch page ID's, for example:
{code}http://<site>.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=type=page&limit=200&start=156400{code}
fields.summary: Call against Content API with a higher start index for pagination is timing out

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding an inline comment inside the Chart macro seems to throw an error. On some instances, if you try to highlight multiple table cells and add the comment, it will allow you. But it throws an error when you highlight only a single word or a single table cell of data inside the Chart macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new blank page
 # Insert the Chart macro with any settings as long as there is text data within it
 # Add an inline comment on the text data inside the Chart macro

h3. Expected Results

Inline comment is added
h3. Actual Results

The comment is not placed and it throws an error on the comment box. Screenshot added below:
!image-2021-11-17-17-24-25-441.png|width=305,height=135!
h3. Workaround

Go to edit mode on the same page and add the inline comment while in edit mode.
fields.summary: Adding inline comment on the Chart macro throws an error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sometimes, during space import in cloud instances, the below error occurred 
ERROR: insert or update on table "label" violates foreign key constraint "fk_label_owner" Detail: Key (owner)=(8a6fc9e9688de83b016895efe5d70060) is not present in table "user_mapping". 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure that a user has a different user key in source and destination instance and user has added labels in destination instance for any page
 # Export the space from source instance and 
 # Import the space in destination instance 

h3. Expected Results

Import should be successful

h3. Actual Results

{code:java}
 ERROR: insert or update on table "label" violates foreign key constraint "fk_label_owner" Detail: Key (owner)=(8a6fc9e9688de83b016895efe5d70060) is not present in table "user_mapping".{code}

h3. Workaround
Retry the import 
If retry doesn't work, Copy the user key from destination instance and replace with the user key in  in entities.xml that is causing the issue and reimport the space
fields.summary: Space import throws a constraint violation error on table "Label"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Excerpt Include macro in a legacy editor page fails to display smart links. Instead, it displays the complete raw URL. It also happens when the page is converted to a new editor. In the new editor, it does show a smart URL in the Edit mode but fails to load the same once Published.

This specifically happens when we include a space URL in the Excerpt Macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with Excerpt Macro and add a few spaces, page URLs.
 # Create another page in a Legacy Editor with Excerpt Include Macro with the above Excerpt.

h3. Expected Results

Smart links to be displayed on the Excerpt Include Macro page just like how it shows in the Excerpt Macro Page.
h3. Actual Results
 # In the excerpt include page, the page displays Raw URL when in an old editor.
 # If the page in step(1) is converted i.e., without panel, it shows smart links in the new editor.
 # If an excerpt include is placed inside a panel macro in the old editor, it again fails to render as a smart link.
 # If the page in step(3) is converted, then in the edit mode of the new editor page, it shows the smart link as expected but when published, it shows a raw URL.

Attached screenshots are some test results.

!image-2021-11-17-19-52-05-353.png! 
!image-2021-11-17-19-52-21-690.png! 
!image-2021-11-17-19-52-29-655.png! 
!image-2021-11-17-19-52-35-718.png! 
!image-2021-11-17-19-52-42-621.png!

In the screenshots, if a page name contains:
{*}New{*}: New Editor
{*}Old{*}: Legacy/Old Editor
{*}Converted{*}: Old/Legacy editor to new editor.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior in an old/legacy editor.

For the converted page from an old editor, remove the panel and just include the excerpt include macro.
fields.summary: Excerpt Include macro in a legacy editor page fails to display smart links

fields.description:
Currently, when updating a page in Confluence that has Jira Macro with Issue links - will cause the links to update the Last-Modified date for all issues linked to the page in each subsequent publish.

This can cause issues when Board in Jira does not recognize these as closed due to being updated.

Perhaps updating the issue links for only Jira issues when first added could be helpful.
fields.summary: Jira issue macro updates all links when the page is updated in Confluence.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The custom field called "{*}Test Setup{*}" doesn't reflect data while being added at the end of the Jira issues macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert the Jira issue macro in the confluence page and try using the "{*}test setup{*}" field.
 # This will not reflect any data.
 # Try using the "{*}Requirements{*}" field along with the "{*}test setup{*}" field.
 !image-2021-11-17-17-03-22-452.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The data for the *test setup* should reflect data even when the *requirement* field is not added.
h3. Actual Results

The data for the *Test setup* field is empty.
h3. Workaround

The workaround is adding the "{*}test setup{*}" field between other fields and even without adding requirements the data reflects fine.
fields.summary: Custom field called "Test setup" is not reflecting data in Jira issues macro.
Ability to add a variable to a template in page editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Disabling the "Autowatch" option doesn't deactivate the auto watching when adding inline comments on pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Disable the *Autowatch* option from email settings
 # Highlight the text on the unwatched page
 # Select the add comment button that appears above the highlighted text
 # Enter your comment and select *Save* (Ctrl+S or ⌘+S)

h3. Expected Results

The page should remain unwatched.
h3. Actual Results

The page becomes watched.
h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: Disabling the "Autowatch" option doesn't deactivate the auto watching when adding inline comments on pages.

fields.description:
Currently when you archive/move a child page the *inherited page restrictions* are not moved/archived with the child page. This can cause unwanted user to view content that should be restricted, especially when archiving pages on a *public space*.

It would be ideal if when moving/archiving a page, we ask the user if they want the child page to keep the *inherited page restrictions* from the parent page.
fields.summary: Provide option for inherited page restrictions to be adopted when moving/archiving a page

fields.description:

Reference ticket for the Jira Solution: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Remove-user-name-from-quot-Send-quot-field-in-email-notification/qaq-p/1473785]
fields.summary: Confluence Email Change Ability

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cannot view app requests without site admin permissions
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a user to the site and grant confluence product admin permissions 
 # Login as the user
 # Access the app request tab under conf admin - settings

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to view the app requests and action accordingly
h3. Actual Results

Error occurred: 

We ran into a little trouble. It might just be a hiccup. Try again in a bit."

HTTP trace reveals an error 403:

status":403,"error":"Forbidden","message":"Unauthorized user: does not have sufficient permissions"}
h3. Workaround

Add user to the site admins group
fields.summary: Cannot view app requests without site admin permissions

fields.description:
HOT-97255 was created as the batched email notifications stopped working in Hello. It was raised as Sev-3 which does not ping any on-call. 
Prod release continued despite of this HOT as the current script looks at release blockers and stops the deployment if it fails.

Internal users may not know about this process and raising HOTs should be enough.
If there can be a way of looking into automating if any HOTs are open to stop the deployment.
fields.summary: Process around looking into HOTs v/s release blockers

fields.description:
It took around 2.5 hours for the fix to be just deployed to all prod shards. Hot-fix should be able to deploy faster than this.
During the PIR meeting, SRE mentioned there is a way to speed this up. 

There are 2 suggestions:
1. The runbooks can be updated with the way of bypassing certain things which can enable it to finish faster.

2. Check if anamoly detectors are really needed and if they are actually testing anything. If not, removing them might help to speed up.
fields.summary: Reduce the monolith deploy time during hotfix

fields.description: There are limited tests around emails flows. Identify and add tests around batched and non-batched emails.
fields.summary: Add acceptance/integration tests for email flows

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Team Calendars allows users to create events with different recurrent schedules, such as yearly. It also gives you the ability to edit the date of a particular Instance of the recurrence, without affecting the other Instances of it. However, if you change the date of an Instance, you won't be able to delete it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a Calendar you have access to, or create a new one. 
 # Click on a date to create a new event.
 # Set a title for this event.
 # On the *Repeat event* dropdown, select {*}Yearly{*}.
 # Click on {*}Save{*}.
 # Drag the event and drop it on a different date. Alternatively, click on the event, and change the {*}Start Date{*}/{*}End Date{*} (make sure that *Edit this instance only* is flagged).
 # Click on the modified event.
 # Click on the *Trash* icon to delete this event.
 # Make sure that *This instance only* is flagged and click on {*}Delete{*}.

h3. Expected Results

This instance (single event) should be deleted.
h3. Actual Results

The instance (single event) is not deleted.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to delete a single Instance of a yearly recurring event after changing its date

fields.description:
It can be observed on 9th Nov, there is a drop in emails sent as opposed to last Monday.  We should try to build anamoly detection around it.  Use terraform to manage the alerts. We can use cc-notifications repository to manage this. 

Link to dashboard https://atlassian.signalfx.com/#/dashboard/EgNoXp9A0AA?startTime=-1w&endTime=Now&variables%5B%5D=micros_service_id%3Dmicros_service_id:%5B%22conf-prod-us-hello%22%5D&variables%5B%5D=environment%3Denvironment:%5B%22prod-west2%22%5D&groupId=Ef4qMvkAwAA&configId=EgNoYtDA4AA
!Count of Individual Emails sent chart.png!
fields.summary: Add anamoly detectors on emails sent from confluence cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding a Custom Content Property in a CQL query through REST API, pagination is not working.

I'm able to run the first query URL, it generates the "next" URL, which I'm also able to run. When I get and run the "prev" URL from the "next" I get a 400 response.

 

It looks like it only happens when I use my Content Property in the order by clause.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Please check steps to reproduce [here|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-7021?focusedCommentId=657372]: 
h3. Expected Results

The prev link works and we get the results from the previous page
h3. Actual Results

400 status
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pagination not working on Content Search endpoint when using a custom Property

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding a Dynamic Content Macro to a page, and changing the macro width, a horizontal scrollbar is displayed even when there's no content on the macro to justify this scrollbar.
It's only displayed in Edit mode.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the page [DEVHELP-7055|https://gdias-test.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TEST/pages/15204353/DEVHELP-7055]

 # Click edit

 # Click the macro and click “Go full width"

 # Click back in the "Back to Center“ button

 # You’ll see a horizontal scroll bar even though there’s not horizontal content

h3. Expected Results

No scrollbar is displayed unless there's content in the macro to justify it
h3. Actual Results

Scrollbar is displayed when no content
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Horizontal scrollbars appear when dynamic content macro shrinks…
